member.name: OBJECTS_AND_NAME_A
member.summary: The OBJECTS_AND_NAME structure contains a string that identifies a trustee by name and additional strings that identify the object types of an object-specific access control entry (ACE).

summary.para: Indicates whether the ObjectTypeName and InheritedObjectTypeName members contain strings. This parameter can be a combination of the following values.

listheader.description: The ObjectTypeName member contains a string.
The InheritedObjectTypeName member contains a string.

member.name: OBJECTS_AND_NAME_A.ObjectType
member.summary: Specifies a value from the enumeration that indicates the type of object.

summary.para: A pointer to a null-terminated string that identifies the type of object to which the ACE applies.
This string must be a valid LDAP display name in the Active Directory schema.
A pointer to a null-terminated string that identifies the type of object that can inherit the ACE.
This string must be a valid LDAP display name in the Active Directory schema.

If the ACE_INHERITED_OBJECT_TYPE_PRESENT bit is not set in the ObjectsPresent member, the InheritedObjectTypeName member is ignored, and all types of child objects can inherit the ACE. Otherwise, only the specified object type can inherit the ACE. In either case, inheritance is also controlled by the inheritance flags in the structure as well as by any protection against inheritance placed on the child objects.

member.name: OBJECTS_AND_NAME_A.ptstrName
member.summary: A pointer to a null-terminated string that contains the name of the trustee.

In either case, inheritance is also controlled by the inheritance flags in the structure as well as by any protection against inheritance placed on the child objects.
